title: Are plants living things or living beings? - Quora

response.answer_text: Anything which is composed of a cell/cells (a cell is a chemical process - mainly combustion - taking place within a membrane) is called a living thing. All plants and animals are composed of cells, so they are all 'living things'. The term 'being' - 'a living being' - is applied to human beings. We say humans are living beings, but we don't say cats or plants are living beings. It seems that the 'being' part of the phrase implies understanding/thought/speech. Plants don't have these traits.Because we can think and talk, we have given names to what we see and these terms are intended to be specific. With greater scientific knowledge we have been able to classify living things in more detail.

Plants shows the cycle that a living organism exhibit like birth , growth ,response to surrounding, undergoes process of agening and finally dies. They exhibit the process of photosynthesis (a photochemical reaction during which hydrogen and water molecules get oxidised in the presence of sunlight to form carbohydrates ,oxygen ,water molecule), It exhibit different morphology, it increases in size ,it undergoes cellular division ,I may reproduce asexually/sexual , it can produce offspring for further generations just as human reproduce sexually for reproduction in race . It grows throughout lifespan it has and undergoes agening and finally dies. From these major factors we can say that it is a living organism.

Plants are living things.  Here some definitions of life: Martin Thoma's answer to What is life? and John Brew's answer to What is life? Plants are probably not living beings.I don't think a plant is a living being. To me, the term being in the context of "living being" implies an element of intelligence or consciousness.  I think of living beings as sentient. I believe animals are living beings.

For me there's no difference between a living thing and a living being. Anything which is conscious is living.  But it cannot be decided at atomic or sub-atomic levels. A dead tree even though not growing and flowering but at atomic level is alive and vibrating at a frequency.

Names are given for simplicity of human understanding. Names given to things and living things in India do have meaning and significance. While we should not argue about living thing or living being. But in Indian languages we differenciate things but not discriminate things. Plants are alive is all we need to understand. When differences become tools to discriminate, people become disaster.
plants are considered as living things because they fulfill all the characteristics of living things plants also react to their environment and they also grow with the help of photosynthesis
If you are asking if a plant is a living thing, the answer is YES.
Because they also inhale and exhale oxygen and carbon dioxide but make food by themselves.
